location.hideout_type: Underground laboratories, disguised as ordinary sects, or deep within ancient ruins.
location.strategy: Infiltration. They often replace leaders of other sects using disguises or soul shifting.

ideology.contrast: Unlike the 'Fanatical' Blood Cult (Hyeolgyo) or 'Might-obsessed' Demonic Cult (Magyo), Baijiao seeks 'Knowledge' and 'Immortality' through forbidden means.
ideology.goal: Transcending human limits, Soul Transfer (Immortality), Overturning the Wulin order via conspiracy.

control_mechanism.effect: Insects planted in the heart/organs. Can kill traitors remotely. Ensures absolute obedience through fear, not faith.

combat_style.summary: Sorcery (Sul-beop) over Martial Arts. Mental attacks and Traps.
combat_style.strength: Superior in Formations and Curses compared to Zhuge or Mosan.
combat_style.weakness: Physical martial arts are often weaker than major sects; reliant on preparation and tricks.

signature_ultimate.name: 이혼대법 (Soul Transfer Great Art / 移魂大法)
signature_ultimate.description: The ultimate forbidden art. Transferring one's soul into another body (vessel).
signature_ultimate.usage: Used by elders to extend life or infiltrate enemy leadership.
signature_ultimate.risk: Extremely difficult failure rate; requires specific conditions.

list: 최혼섭백마력 (Soul Urging Spirit Controlling Magic Power)
만겁윤회탈혼대법 (Myriad Kalpa Samsara Soul Stealing Art)
분영축골신공 (Shadow Dividing Bone Shrinking Art) - Changing body size/shape.
역용술 (Disguise Art) - Perfect imitation of others.
삼본흡정술 (Three Root Essence Absorption Art) - Draining vitality (Gi/Jing).

narrative_role: The 'Hidden Boss' revealed late in the story.
The faction responsible for the 'Imposter' plot (e.g., The Shaolin Abbot was actually a Baijiao spy).
Source of supernatural horror elements (Soul stealing, Mind control).
The intellectual villain who mocks the protagonist's 'brute force' justice.
